biogHists.text:
KUED is a Public Broadcasting Service (PBS) affiliated television station that has operated in conjunction with the University of Utah since 1958. In addition to airing nationally syndicated PBS programs KUED produces and airs television programs and documentaries made by local and regional filmmakers and about local and regional issues. KUED was the recipient of the first Rocky Mountain Emmy Award of Excellence for the Best Overall TV Station, which recognizes the station's commitment to serving the community through its productions and outreach programs. The Rocky Mountain Emmy Awards represent a division of the National Academy of Television Arts and Sciences that honors productions from Arizona, New Mexico, Utah, Wyoming and El Centro, California. Based in Salt Lake City, Utah, KUED now broadcasts on digital channels 7.1 (KUED), 7.2 (KUED World) and 7.3 (KUED V-me, a Spanish language station).

From the guide to the KUED-TV productions audio-visual collection, 1966-2010, (J. Willard Marriott Library, University of Utah)

resource.source:
<objectXMLWrap>
               <did xmlns="urn:isbn:1-931666-22-9">
                  <repository>
                     <corpname>J. Willard Marriott Library, University of Utah</corpname>
                     <subarea>University Archives and Records Management</subarea>
                     <address>
                        <addressline>University Archives & Records Management</addressline>
                        <addressline>Special Collections</addressline>
                        <addressline>J. Willard Marriott Library</addressline>
                        <addressline>666 Guardsman Way</addressline>
                        <addressline>Salt Lake City, UT 84112</addressline>
                        <addressline>Tel: 801-581-8242</addressline>
                        <addressline>Fax: 801-581-8192</addressline>
                     </address>
                  </repository>
                  <unitid>Acc0355</unitid>
                  <unittitle>KUED-TV records</unittitle>
                  <unitdate>1953-1970</unitdate>
                  <origination>
                     <corpname>KUED-TV (Television station : Salt Lake City, Utah)</corpname>
                  </origination>
                  <physdesc>
                     <extent>3.5 linear feet + 1 oversized box</extent>
                  </physdesc>
                  <abstract>KUED-TV was the first educational television station in Utah and began broadcasting on January 20, 1958.  It is currently  a member of the Public Broadcasting  Service.  Within the University of Utah, the station has been administratively part of Media Services since 1976.  During the period covered by these records, C. Richard Evans, Keith M. Engar, and Rex L. Campbell served as station managers.  This collection contains annual reports, scripts, correspondence, license applications, press releases, reports, surveys, program schedules, and scrapbooks (1963-1970) of KUED-TV.</abstract>
                  <langmaterial>
                     <language>English</language>
                  </langmaterial>
               </did>
            </objectXMLWrap>
resource.title: KUED-TV records 1953-1970
resource.abstract: KUED-TV was the first educational television station in Utah and began broadcasting on January 20, 1958.  It is currently  a member of the Public Broadcasting  Service.  Within the University of Utah, the station has been administratively part of Media Services since 1976.  During the period covered by these records, C. Richard Evans, Keith M. Engar, and Rex L. Campbell served as station managers.  This collection contains annual reports, scripts, correspondence, license applications, press releases, reports, surveys, program schedules, and scrapbooks (1963-1970) of KUED-TV.

                     <subarea>Audio Visual Archives</subarea>
                     <address>
                        <addressline>Special Collections</addressline>
                        <addressline>295 South 1500 East</addressline>
                        <addressline>Salt Lake City, Utah 84112-0860</addressline>

                     </address>
                  </repository>
                  <unitid>A0431</unitid>
                  <unittitle>KUED-TV productions audio-visual collection</unittitle>
                  <unitdate>1966-2010</unitdate>
                  <origination>
                     <corpname>KUED-TV (Television station : Salt Lake City, Utah)</corpname>
                  </origination>
                  <physdesc>
                     <extent>64 VHS videocassettes, 11 DVDs, 83 compact discs, 1 U-matic videocassette, 1 Betacam videoassette, 1 Mini-DV videocassette, 1 Fuji D3001 videocassette and 1 16mm film</extent>
                  </physdesc>
                  <abstract>The KUED-TV productions audio-visual collection (1966-2010) consists of recordings of local and regional television programs produced by or for KUED-TV.  Most of the programs focus on topics related to Utah or the American West.  KUED-TV is a Public Broadcasting Service (PBS) affiliated television station brodcasting from the University of Utah.</abstract>
                  <langmaterial>Materials in 
        <language>English</language>.
      </langmaterial>
               </did>
            </objectXMLWrap>

                  <unitdate>1986-1993</unitdate>
                  <origination>
                     <corpname>University of Utah. Vice President for University Relations Office</corpname>
                  </origination>
                  <physdesc>
                     <extent>1.25 linear feet</extent>
                  </physdesc>
                  <abstract>The Vice President for University Relations administers the offices of Alumni, Development, Governmental Relations, Intercollegiate Athletics, and Public Relations. During the time covered by these records, Ted Capener served as Vice President. This collection primarily contains correspondence and memoranda to and from the University Relations Department. Other materials document Ted Capener's involvement with KUED-TV and the Utah Education Network.</abstract>
                  <langmaterial>
                     <language>English</language>
                  </langmaterial>
               </did>
            </objectXMLWrap>
resource.title: University of Utah Vice President for University Relations Office records 1986-1993
resource.abstract: The Vice President for University Relations administers the offices of Alumni, Development, Governmental Relations, Intercollegiate Athletics, and Public Relations. During the time covered by these records, Ted Capener served as Vice President. This collection primarily contains correspondence and memoranda to and from the University Relations Department. Other materials document Ted Capener's involvement with KUED-TV and the Utah Education Network.

                  <unittitle>University of Utah Media Services records</unittitle>
                  <unitdate>1959-1985</unitdate>
                  <origination>
                     <corpname>University of Utah. Media Services</corpname>
                  </origination>
                  <physdesc>
                     <extent>6 linear ft.</extent>
                  </physdesc>
                  <abstract>Media Services was created in 1976 and included KUED, KUER, Instructional Television, Educational Media, and Correspondence Study.  Rex L. Campbell served as Director of Radio and Television Services from 1964 to 1975.  Robert M. Reed was General Manager of KUED from 1977 to 1978.  Bruce L. Christensen became General Manager of KUED in 1979 and Director of Media Services in 1981.  This collection contains correspondence, meeting minutes, and subject files primarily from KUED and secondarily from other divisions of Media Services.</abstract>
                  <langmaterial>
                     <language>English</language>
                  </langmaterial>
               </did>
            </objectXMLWrap>
resource.title: University of Utah Media Services records 1959-1985
resource.abstract: Media Services was created in 1976 and included KUED, KUER, Instructional Television, Educational Media, and Correspondence Study.  Rex L. Campbell served as Director of Radio and Television Services from 1964 to 1975.  Robert M. Reed was General Manager of KUED from 1977 to 1978.  Bruce L. Christensen became General Manager of KUED in 1979 and Director of Media Services in 1981.  This collection contains correspondence, meeting minutes, and subject files primarily from KUED and secondarily from other divisions of Media Services.
resource.displayEntry: University of Utah Media Services records, 1959-1985

resource.source:
<objectXMLWrap>
               <mods xmlns="http://www.loc.gov/mods/v3">
                  <recordInfo>
                     <recordOrigin>WorldCat:70716988</recordOrigin>
                     <recordContentSource>ISIL:OCLC-UUM</recordContentSource>
                  </recordInfo>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>University of Utah. Media Services.</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/cre">Creator</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
                  <titleInfo>
                     <title>Media Services records. 1958-1992.</title>
                  </titleInfo>
                  <abstract>This collection contains catalogs, correspondence, memoranda, minutes programming logs, and reports from the departments of Instructional Media Services, Instructional Television, KUED, and KULC spanning the years 1958 to 1992. The bulk of the material was generated after the establishment of Media Services in 1976. 42.75 linear feet of the collection comes from KUED. Approximately 80% of the material consists of programming logs from Instructional Television, KUED, and KULC. </abstract>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>University of Utah</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/rps">Repository</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
               </mods>
            </objectXMLWrap>
resource.title: Media Services records. 1958-1992.
resource.abstract: This collection contains catalogs, correspondence, memoranda, minutes programming logs, and reports from the departments of Instructional Media Services, Instructional Television, KUED, and KULC spanning the years 1958 to 1992. The bulk of the material was generated after the establishment of Media Services in 1976. 42.75 linear feet of the collection comes from KUED. Approximately 80% of the material consists of programming logs from Instructional Television, KUED, and KULC.
resource.displayEntry: University of Utah. Media Services. Media Services records. 1958-1992.
